column5: Fish weren't as cooperative as last time but we got a few into the boat and as always it beats working.  Casting a blue/silver cyclops:   Trolling a husky jerk:   I caught a twin of ^that^ one casting a x-rap and we had 3 fish for dinner.  My son didn't get any pike into the boat but he did snag this casting one of his favourite lures (He bought it last year with his own money, then caught a pike with it the first time he used it, and no matter how much we suggested better pike choices he insisted on using it).
Did you ever do what you were told at that age Rob?  Great pics bud.

Did you ever do what you were told at that age Rob?  Great pics bud.  Ya, I was also half expecting him to get a 40 incher on it as well. Here is the pike he caught last year while bass fishing with "his" lure.

Nice going guys!  I think every kid that fishes has "that lure".  Real nice father son photo of him with his pike! Thats a nice one! Bet he was real proud!  Oh, nice to see Im not the only one enjoying a fresh feed of pike!
Having confidence in the lure your throwing is half the battle, lol  Looks like a great day on the water with family.

Nice going guys!  I think every kid that fishes has "that lure".  Real nice father son photo of him with his pike! Thats a nice one! Bet he was real proud!  Oh, nice to see Im not the only one enjoying a fresh feed of pike! Nothing wrong with small pike from cool/cold water.  Having confidence in the lure your throwing is half the battle, lol  Looks like a great day on the water with family.  Ya, I have a few hundred lures and yet it's the same handful almost every trip. I had hoped that we'd catch a few quick pike and then he'd switch but since we didn't provide the evidence he never felt the need to change.
Great post. Lots of father/son/daughter reports lately. Time for me to get on it!
